snippet: The attack on Nasir, in the oil-rich Upper Nile State, is the biggest threat so far to the shaky cease-fire signed on May 9.
abstract: South Sudanese rebels clash with government soldiers in Nasir, small town near Ethiopian border in the oil-rich Upper Nile State, adding to fears that shaky cease-fire agreement signed in May could collapse.
lead_paragraph: The attack on Nasir, in the oil-rich Upper Nile State, is the biggest threat so far to the shaky cease-fire signed on May 9.

headline.main: South Sudanese Rebels Clash With Government Soldiers in Town Near Ethiopian Border
headline.print_headline: South Sudanese Rebels Clash With Government Soldiers in Town Near Ethiopian Border
